Looking at your log below, it seems that www.foo.dk is 
http://www.arto.dk/ <http://www.arto.dk/>  and the login page is 
http://www.arto.dk/login.asp.  If that is so, if I go to the latter 
link, I get a 200 code and '*Siden blev desvï¿½rre ikke fundet!'* (My 
danish is not the best but if I was to guess.... ).

The authentication code isn't too smart.  Per site you designate a login 
page.  As soon as it trips over the site, it runs the auth against the 
designated login page.  Are you configuring a login for both seeds?  If 
its even possible, double-login should be harmless.   IIRC, the order in 
which seeds are crawled can not be guaranteed.  Otherwise, you could set 
up auth for the seed that will be crawled first (as you suggest below).

St.Ack


Bjarne Andersen wrote:
>
> When I try setting up credentials for a HTML-login on some page I have 
> a problem with the first seed not getting crawled.
>
> I have 2 seeds:
> http://www.foo.dk/ <http://www.foo.dk/>
> http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html <http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html>
>
> The top of the crawl-log goes:
> 2007-08-07T09:05:01.510Z 1 52 dns:www.foo.dk P http://www.foo.dk/ 
> <http://www.foo.dk/> text/dns #014 20070807090500909+76
> sha1:ZFEUC72STTHW6WGT3CQ7FSC5ZELHUCDG - -
> 2007-08-07T09:05:01.920Z 200 0 http://www.foo.dk/robots.txt 
> <http://www.foo.dk/robots.txt> P http://www.foo.dk/ 
> <http://www.foo.dk/> text/plain #003 20070807090501840+75
> sha1:3I42H3S6NNFQ2MSVX7XZKYAYSCX5QBYJ - -
> 2007-08-07T09:05:02.234Z -50 - http://www.foo.dk/ <http://www.foo.dk/> 
> - - no-type #014 - - - 3t
> 2007-08-07T09:05:02.481Z 200 88 http://www.foo.dk/login.asp 
> <http://www.foo.dk/login.asp> P http://www.arto.dk/ 
> <http://www.arto.dk/> text/html #001 20070807090502240+221
> sha1:3KZ4VXNSIFLJTECHCFGTXFRCPCNDOZAZ - -
> 2007-08-07T09:05:03.276Z 200 31157 http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html 
> <http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html> - - text/html #041 20070807090502792+82
> sha1:5RKIJVDCIFWGCCYH73GXG6TGL6LIYT7F - -
>
> And the crawler does the login - finds out that the login-page is a 
> prerequisit (P) to the first seed
>
> But the first seed never gets retried after the login - ends with 
> status-code (-50)
>
> If I add a dummy seed to the top of the seed-list things seem to work. 
> But does the crawler guarentee that the order of seeds in the
> seed-list is always the crawling-order ?
>
> If my seedlist have only the first seed the crawler stops after the 
> login-page no matter what
>
> best
